title: Ticket #7159: Allow users to utilize the token request workflow
description:
The token request workflow currently requires ADMINISTRATOR access to utilize. This was done purposely in 8.9.3 to avoid too many changes at once.

However, this limitation was a bit artificial - in 8.9.4, we can relax it slightly. Instead of requiring ADMINISTRATOR authorization for all requests, additionally allow users to list/approve tokens for their own identity.

That is, if there is a request for the bbockelm identity, then either an administrator or user bbockelm should be allowed to approve the request.

Users can already generate their own tokens from a login session (so this isn't allowing new privileges) - but allowing them to additionally utilize the token request workflow reduces the likelihood the user copy/pastes their tokens into random places.
